attributes.additional_details:
The Council have decided not to go ahead with the pool project development due to concerns around the financial running costs and have not released the report for public scrutiny! The community deserves to be enabled to gain the opportunity to have a swimming pool developed in the town 
The swimming pool based at Netherhall School foreclosed to make way for the new swimming pool project within the town. The Green policy, Sustainable Development strategies can be used to reduced running costs and revise the current business plan.
attributes.background: Maryport in Cumbria has no public or private swimming pool in the town or immediate area. Funds have been specifically allocated under the levelling up criteria/ regeneration for the development of a swimming pool.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about Maryport Pool are a matter for Cumberland Council, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly: https://www.cumberland.gov.uk/your-council/have-your-say/petitions
